intro: Koeleria youngii, commonly known as the Sierra grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant typically produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Koeleria youngii thrives in rocky, arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and forage for local wildlife.
